results.content:
Hello Oleksandr,

I hope you are doing well.
I am a senior developer skilled about Angular, but novice about NgRx.
I want to thank you for this very good course.
I learnt 2 other ones about NgRx, but yours is more comprehensive as Redux is not easy to understand. I code along your videos, not necessary exactly like you, nevertheless, it is a very good training to do it in this way.

I recommand this course for advanced or medium students. For sure, it is necessary to be quite skilled in Angular to follow this course.

Best regards

Vincent

results.content:
I liked this course a lot. Throughout the course author creates project from zero to fully working application using Angular and NgRx.
His only focus in on frontend, i.e. backend is already created so you do not have to spend time on backend development.
You can learn a lot in this course, primarly NgRx but also some RxJs.
But take into account that this course is not for absolute beginners.
There are several reasons for this:
  1) pace of author's coding is prety fast, you must be familiar with Angular to follow along
  2) author is not using VS Code, he is using Vim because this is his preference
  3) author creates every component from zero using new file (he is not using Angular schematics). 
So to be able to follow along some Angular knowledge is required (but not NgRx)
I would highly recommend this course to anyone who wants to learn NgRx.

results.content: The coding vs developed in difeent IDE than VS code and that makes it more confusing. Thee are no shortcuts explained. For a 20 min Module in Section 2 : Lesson 6, I have to watch 45 mins and type differently in VScode to generate components, Modules and directives. Definitely should update the display so that it's easy to understand.

results.content: Brilliant Tutorials. In-depth explanation of all the Redux Architecture and RxJS operators right from its functionality to its real world use in the application. The file structure followed is also outstanding as everything seems modular and clean. Would definitely recommend my peers to refer these tuts who are absolute beginners. Thanks :)
